en.label: The Vale Reckoning
en.description: A fantasy calendar used in northern mountain valleys, where each season breathes myth and memory. Features an 8-month cycle, 6-day week, and sacred festival days.

months.name: Frostwane
months.description: The dying of winter. A time of silence, hunger, and huddled survival.

months.name: Thawmarch
months.description: The breaking thaw. Ice splits, rivers churn, and wolves hunt the weak.

months.name: Greenspire
months.description: First blooms and returning birds. Rains soften the land for planting.

months.name: Embertide
months.description: The burn months. Smoke, sowing, and the dance of ash over fields.

months.name: Highsun
months.description: Midyear heat. Dreams burn bright, tempers burn brighter.

months.name: Harvestwane
months.description: Golden dusk. Crops ripen, blades are sharpened, debts are settled.

months.name: Gravecall
months.description: Long shadows and whispered names. The living and dead walk closest.

months.name: Deepfrost
months.description: The world stills again. Fires dim, and breath clouds in the chill.

weekdays.name: Brightday
weekdays.description: Auspicious. New journeys, clear skies, and clean starts.

weekdays.name: Graftday
weekdays.description: Work and toil. Markets bustle, and fields are plowed.

weekdays.name: Stoneday
weekdays.description: Hearth and holdfast. A day for home, rest, and repairs.

weekdays.name: Bitterday
weekdays.description: Ill omens and arguments. Avoid risk and stay wary.

weekdays.name: Wyrdday
weekdays.description: Mystic alignments. Tales are told, stars watched, and truths divined.

weekdays.name: Graveday
weekdays.description: Remembrance and endings. The dead are honored, the past weighed.

intercalary.name: Hearthmoor
intercalary.description: A night of survival rites and shared flame. The long dark wanes.

intercalary.name: Stormrest
intercalary.description: Offerings are left to the storm spirits. Farmers call this the floodwatch.

intercalary.name: Suncrest
intercalary.description: The longest day. Madness, passion, and visions flare under the open sky.

intercalary.name: Ashfall
intercalary.description: Ashes of the year are buried or scattered. Old names are sung, and debts burned.

en.description: The main moon, personification of the moon in Norse mythology, brother to Sól
The night moon, Norse goddess of night who rides her horse across the sky

seasons.name: Winter
seasons.description: The cold season culminating in Deepwinter's harsh embrace.

seasons.name: Spring
seasons.description: The season of renewal beginning with Hammer's thaw and ending with Ches's growth.

seasons.name: Summer
seasons.description: The warm season of Tarsakh's melting through Kythorn's height.

seasons.name: Autumn
seasons.description: The harvest season from Flamerule through Marpenoth's end.

events.name: Hearthmoor
events.description: A night of survival rites and shared flame. The long dark wanes. Sacred festival marking the end of winter's grip.

events.name: The Day of Goose
events.description: A peculiar festival honoring a legendary mallard who saved a village from winter starvation. Waterfowl return, and migration begins. Also known as 'The Duck What Saved Us.'

events.name: Stormrest
events.description: Offerings are left to the storm spirits. Farmers call this the floodwatch. Sacred day between spring and summer.

events.name: The Thing
events.description: Parliamentary assembly of free folk. Disputes are settled, laws debated, and oaths sworn. Traditionally held on the first Brightday of the burning months.

events.name: Suncrest
events.description: The longest day. Madness, passion, and visions flare under the open sky. The sacred midsummer festival.

events.name: First Harvest Rite
events.description: Offerings to the earth spirits. The first sheaf is bound and blessed. Blades are sharpened for the coming reaping.

events.name: Winter Market
events.description: The last great market before Deepfrost locks the vale. Trade goods, hire guards, settle accounts. Held on the final Graftday before winter.

events.name: Ashfall
events.description: Ashes of the year are buried or scattered. Old names are sung, and debts burned. Sacred day of endings and remembrance.

events.name: Vigil of Ancestors
events.description: On Graveday nearest the full moon of Nótt during Gravecall, the dead are closest. Lanterns are lit, names spoken, and offerings left at burial cairns.

events.name: Midwinter Feast
events.description: The darkest day. Communities gather to share stores, tell tales, and ward off the hungry cold. Doors are barred, fires stoked high.

events.name: The Wyrd Conjunction
events.description: Every four years when Máni and Nótt align, seers gather on Wyrdday to divine the coming years. Visions are strongest, truths most perilous.

events.name: Lorekeeper's Night
events.description: Monthly reminder for loremasters to prepare tales, secrets, and hooks. Check your notes, weave your threads.

dateFormats.formal: The {{ss-day format="ordinal"}} day of {{ss-month format="name"}} in the {{year}} year of Vale Reckoning
dateFormats.formal-intercalary: {{intercalary}} in the {{year}} year of Vale Reckoning
